alert.note: Alert for Kent; Stonewall (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 31 at 11:35AM CDT until August 31 at 3:00PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: .Rainfall has been ongoing for serveral hours and is expected to continue, thus increasing the risk of minor flooding. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Texas, including the following counties, Kent and Stonewall, mainly south of Aspermont and Jayton. * WHEN...Until 130 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1135 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Aspermont, Peacock, Swenson and Old Glory. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
